title: Ezra Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ezra chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ezra Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ezra Chapter 10.

questions.question: What did Ezra do before a very great congregation assembled to him?
options: Prayed and confessed, weeping
Sang a song of praise
Delivered a sermon
Wrote a letter
questions.correctAnswer: Prayed and confessed, weeping
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:1 says that Ezra prayed, confessed, wept, and cast himself down before the house of God before the congregation assembled.

questions.question: Who spoke to Ezra acknowledging the trespass against God and the taking of strange wives?
options: Shechaniah the son of Jehiel
Jonathan the son of Asahel
Meshullam the Levite
Jeshua the son of Jozadak
questions.correctAnswer: Shechaniah the son of Jehiel
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:2 records that Shechaniah son of Jehiel answered Ezra acknowledging the trespass.

questions.question: What did Shechaniah suggest they do to address the problem of strange wives?
options: Make a covenant with God to put them away
Ignore the issue
Offer sacrifices only
Send the wives away without a covenant
questions.correctAnswer: Make a covenant with God to put them away
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:3 says Shechaniah suggested making a covenant with God to put away the wives and their children according to the law.

questions.question: Who encouraged Ezra to arise and be of good courage to carry out the matter?
options: Shechaniah and the congregation
The priests only
The elders of Israel
The Levites only
questions.correctAnswer: Shechaniah and the congregation
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:4 records Shechaniah encouraging Ezra to arise and be courageous, and that they would be with him.

questions.question: What did Ezra make the chief priests, Levites, and all Israel do regarding the word given?
options: Swear to do according to the word
Write it down
Ignore it
Debate it
questions.correctAnswer: Swear to do according to the word
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:5 states that Ezra made them swear to do according to the word.

questions.question: What did Ezra do after rising from before the house of God?
options: Went into Johanan's chamber and mourned without eating or drinking
Held a feast
Went to the temple to offer sacrifices
Went to the elders of the city
questions.correctAnswer: Went into Johanan's chamber and mourned without eating or drinking
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:6 says Ezra went into Johanan's chamber and mourned, eating no bread or drinking water because of the transgressions.

questions.question: What was proclaimed throughout Judah and Jerusalem to the children of the captivity?
options: That they should gather themselves in Jerusalem
That they should remain where they were
That a feast was to be held
That a new king was appointed
questions.correctAnswer: That they should gather themselves in Jerusalem
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:7 states a proclamation was made for all the children of captivity to gather in Jerusalem.

questions.question: What consequence was given for anyone who did not come within three days?
options: His substance would be forfeited and he separated from the congregation
He would be imprisoned
He would be exiled
He would be fined
questions.correctAnswer: His substance would be forfeited and he separated from the congregation
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:8 explains the punishment of forfeiting property and separation from the congregation for those not coming within three days.

questions.question: On what day and month did all the men of Judah and Benjamin gather in Jerusalem?
options: The 20th day of the 9th month
The 10th day of the 8th month
The 15th day of the 7th month
The 1st day of the 10th month
questions.correctAnswer: The 20th day of the 9th month
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:9 specifies the gathering happened on the 20th day of the ninth month.

questions.question: What did Ezra accuse the people of in his standing address?
options: Transgressing and taking strange wives
Stealing from the temple
Fighting among themselves
Breaking the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: Transgressing and taking strange wives
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:10 records Ezra accusing them of transgressing by taking strange wives.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ezra 10:11, the people were instructed to make confession and separate themselves from the strange wives.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:11 commands confession and separation from strange wives.

questions.question: True or False: The congregation refused to follow Ezra's instructions to put away strange wives.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:12 shows the congregation answered with a loud voice agreeing to do as Ezra said.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ezra 10:13, the people said it was easy to put away the strange wives in one or two days.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:13 states the people said it was not a work of one or two days because many had transgressed.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Ezra 10:17, the examination of all the men who had taken strange wives was completed by the first day of the ______ month.
options: First
Tenth
Ninth
Eleventh
questions.correctAnswer: First
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:17 says the work was finished by the first day of the first month.

questions.question: Who were among those employed about the matter of putting away strange wives?
options: Jonathan the son of Asahel and Jahaziah the son of Tikvah
Ezra and Shechaniah
The chief priests only
The Levites only
questions.correctAnswer: Jonathan the son of Asahel and Jahaziah the son of Tikvah
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:15 identifies Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahaziah son of Tikvah as employed about the matter, with help from Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite.

medium.title: Ezra Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ezra Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with confessing sin and seeking forgiveness. Based on Ezra 10, what is a key biblical principle to encourage them?
options: Confess your sins before God with genuine sorrow and humility
Ignore the sin and trust God will forgive without confession
Only confess sin to other people, not to God
Deny the sin to protect your reputation
questions.correctAnswer: Confess your sins before God with genuine sorrow and humility
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:1 shows Ezra praying and confessing with weeping before God, demonstrating the importance of heartfelt confession and humility. Verses 10:10-11 also call for confession and doing God's pleasure.

questions.question: How does Ezra 10 teach us about trusting God when facing a difficult task in obedience?
options: Be of good courage and act confidently with God’s help
Avoid difficult tasks to prevent failure
Rely solely on human strength and plans
Delay obedience until the task seems easy
questions.correctAnswer: Be of good courage and act confidently with God’s help
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:4 encourages Ezra to rise and be courageous because the matter belongs to him, with others supporting him, showing confidence in God’s guidance.

questions.question: What does Ezra 10 teach about the importance of communal repentance and accountability?
options: The whole congregation should unite in confession and covenant to obey God
Repentance is only a private matter with no community involvement
Only leaders need to repent publicly
Keep sin hidden to avoid shame
questions.correctAnswer: The whole congregation should unite in confession and covenant to obey God
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:1-5 describes a large congregation gathering and swearing an oath together to follow God's word, emphasizing communal accountability and repentance.

questions.question: A fellow believer is feeling overwhelmed by the consequences of sin. How does Ezra 10 encourage perseverance through trials?
options: Recognize the seriousness of sin but continue working steadily to correct it
Give up because the problem is too big
Ignore the consequences and hope for the best
Blame others and avoid responsibility
questions.correctAnswer: Recognize the seriousness of sin but continue working steadily to correct it
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:13-14 acknowledges the difficulty due to many transgressors and rain, yet calls for rulers and elders to address the matter in appointed times, showing perseverance in correction.

questions.question: What biblical truth about marriage and family does Ezra 10 emphasize?
options: Faithfulness to God’s commands in marriage is essential for holiness
Marry whoever you choose regardless of spiritual agreement
Marriage is unimportant to spiritual life
Ignore God’s instructions about marriage
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness to God’s commands in marriage is essential for holiness
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:2-3 and 10:10-11 highlight the problem of intermarriage with foreign wives contrary to God’s law and call for separation to maintain covenant faithfulness.

questions.question: How does Ezra 10 demonstrate the role of leaders in guiding the people toward obedience?
options: Leaders lead by example, encourage repentance, and organize the community
Leaders should ignore sin to avoid conflict
Leaders act independently without involving the people
Leaders only enforce rules without praying or confessing
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders lead by example, encourage repentance, and organize the community
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:5 shows Ezra and priests making the people swear to obey; 10:14-15 mentions appointed leaders managing the process, demonstrating leadership involvement.

questions.question: What does Ezra 10 teach about the importance of prayer and mourning over sin?
options: Sincere prayer and mourning express repentance and dependence on God
Prayer is unnecessary if you confess verbally
Mourning over sin shows weakness
Ignore sin and focus on other things
questions.correctAnswer: Sincere prayer and mourning express repentance and dependence on God
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:1 and 10:6 describe Ezra praying, confessing, weeping, and mourning over the transgression, showing heartfelt repentance before God.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ezra 10, those who did not come to Jerusalem within three days faced losing their possessions and separation from the congregation.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:8 states that anyone not coming within three days would forfeit all their substance and be separated from the congregation.

questions.question: True or False: Ezra 10 shows that God’s people should tolerate sin quietly to maintain peace in the community.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezra 10 calls for confession, covenant-making, and active removal of sin (strange wives), showing that sin should be confronted and dealt with, not tolerated (Ezra 10:10-12, 14).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ezra and the leaders began examining the matter of those who had taken strange wives on the first day of the _____ month.
options: tenth
ninth
first
twelfth
questions.correctAnswer: tenth
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:16 states they sat down to examine the matter on the first day of the tenth month.

questions.question: How can Ezra 10 guide a believer struggling with temptation related to compromising on God’s commands?
options: Confess the sin and take decisive steps to separate from it
Ignore the temptation and hope it goes away
Compromise sometimes if it seems easier
Keep the sin secret to avoid judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Confess the sin and take decisive steps to separate from it
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:11 urges separation from the strange wives and confession to God, teaching the necessity of decisive action against sin.

questions.question: What biblical principle about stewardship and integrity can be learned from Ezra 10’s call to obey God’s law even in difficult matters?
options: Obedience to God’s commands is integral to living with honesty and integrity
It's acceptable to bend God’s laws if circumstances are tough
Integrity is not important if you have good intentions
Stewardship only relates to money, not obedience
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience to God’s commands is integral to living with honesty and integrity
questions.explanation: The chapter emphasizes obeying God’s covenant even when difficult (Ezra 10:3, 10:5), showing integrity in spiritual and practical life.

questions.question: How does Ezra 10 highlight the importance of corporate worship and fellowship in times of crisis?
options: The people gathered together in the street of the house of God to seek God’s mercy
Everyone isolated themselves to avoid shame
Only a few leaders met privately
Worship was suspended until the crisis passed
questions.correctAnswer: The people gathered together in the street of the house of God to seek God’s mercy
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:9 shows the men of Judah and Benjamin gathering at the house of God, trembling and seeking repentance corporately.

questions.question: According to Ezra 10, what role does confession play in reconciliation and restoration within the community?
options: Confession is the first step towards turning away God’s wrath and restoring fellowship
Confession is unnecessary if you feel sorry privately
Confession should be avoided to protect one’s reputation
Confession only involves telling other people, not God
questions.correctAnswer: Confession is the first step towards turning away God’s wrath and restoring fellowship
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:11-14 calls for confession and separation from sin to turn away God’s fierce wrath and restore the community.

questions.question: What does Ezra 10 teach about humility and contentment in the face of communal sin?
options: Humility is shown by acknowledging sin openly and working together for correction
Be proud and defensive to protect your standing
Ignore the problem hoping it will fix itself
Blame others to avoid responsibility
questions.correctAnswer: Humility is shown by acknowledging sin openly and working together for correction
questions.explanation: The people wept sorely (10:1), confessed (10:11-12), and agreed to obey, demonstrating humility and willingness to be corrected.

hard.title: Ezra Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ezra Chapter 10.

questions.question: How does Ezra's act of weeping and casting himself down before the house of God (Ezra 10:1) echo earlier biblical examples of penitence?
options: It parallels David's mourning for Saul and Jonathan in 2 Samuel
It is similar to Moses interceding for Israel in Exodus
It reflects Nehemiah's prayer of confession in Nehemiah 1
It foreshadows Jesus' prayer in Gethsemane
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects Nehemiah's prayer of confession in Nehemiah 1
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:1 describes Ezra's penitential prayer before the house of God, which closely parallels Nehemiah's confession and mourning for Israel's sins recorded in Nehemiah 1, highlighting a theme of communal repentance.

questions.question: What is the significance of Shechaniah's proposal to make a covenant to put away foreign wives in the context of Israel's covenant theology?
options: It signifies renewal of the Sinai covenant purity requirements
It marks a break from Mosaic law towards a new covenant
It reflects a political alliance strategy with surrounding nations
It is an attempt to secularize Israelite society
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies renewal of the Sinai covenant purity requirements
questions.explanation: Shechaniah's call to covenant to put away foreign wives (Ezra 10:3) aligns with covenant purity laws from Sinai that forbid intermarriage with nations that might lead Israel into idolatry, reaffirming the community's commitment to the covenant.

questions.question: In Ezra 10:5, Ezra makes the chief priests, Levites, and all Israel swear to obey the command. How does this public oath function in ancient Near Eastern covenant practices?
options: As a binding social contract invoking divine witness
As a mere formality without legal weight
As a political declaration to foreign powers
As a private agreement exclusive to priests
questions.correctAnswer: As a binding social contract invoking divine witness
questions.explanation: The public oath in Ezra 10:5 reflects ancient Near Eastern covenant customs where oaths before God and community served as solemn, binding agreements reinforcing collective responsibility.

questions.question: Ezra mourned without eating or drinking in the chamber of Johanan (Ezra 10:6). What is the Hebrew term often associated with such fasting and mourning, and what is its theological significance?
options: Taanit, symbolizing repentance and seeking divine favor
Shema, denoting hearing and obedience
Chesed, meaning loving-kindness
Kadesh, relating to sanctification
questions.correctAnswer: Taanit, symbolizing repentance and seeking divine favor
questions.explanation: Ezra's fasting and mourning (Ezra 10:6) correspond to the Hebrew concept of 'taanit' (fast), a ritual act expressing repentance and earnest petition for God's mercy, integral to communal restoration.

questions.question: What is the significance of the three-day ultimatum given to the exiles to gather in Jerusalem (Ezra 10:7-8) in light of covenant renewal rituals in Israelite tradition?
options: It emphasizes urgency and communal accountability
It reflects a Babylonian legal custom
It is a symbolic number representing completeness
It was meant to intimidate foreign nations
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes urgency and communal accountability
questions.explanation: The three-day summons (Ezra 10:7-8) underscores the urgency of covenant renewal and the collective responsibility to respond, mirroring Israelite practices wherein set times facilitated communal repentance.

questions.question: How does the public confession and call to separate from strange wives (Ezra 10:10-11) reflect Deuteronomic law and its emphasis on holiness?
options: It aligns with Deuteronomy's commands to avoid intermarriage to maintain holiness
It contradicts Deuteronomic openness to foreigners
It introduces a new law distinct from Deuteronomy
It reflects a post-exilic innovation without biblical precedent
questions.correctAnswer: It aligns with Deuteronomy's commands to avoid intermarriage to maintain holiness
questions.explanation: Ezra's exhortation (Ezra 10:10-11) to separate from foreign wives directly echoes Deuteronomy 7:3-4, which commands Israel to avoid intermarriage to prevent idolatry and preserve covenantal holiness.

questions.question: The people's response that the task cannot be done in one or two days (Ezra 10:13) reflects what aspect of human nature and communal repentance?
options: Recognition of the complexity and seriousness of corporate sin
Desire to delay obedience
Rejection of Ezra’s authority
Lack of understanding of the law
questions.correctAnswer: Recognition of the complexity and seriousness of corporate sin
questions.explanation: The acknowledgment in Ezra 10:13 that the work is too great for a short time reveals an awareness of the deep impact of sin and the need for thorough, deliberate repentance.

questions.question: What role do the appointed rulers, elders, and judges play in the process described in Ezra 10:14, and how does this relate to Israel’s judicial system in the Pentateuch?
options: They serve as community leaders to administer justice in accordance with Mosaic law
They act as religious priests only
They are foreign officials imposed by Persia
They function as military commanders
questions.correctAnswer: They serve as community leaders to administer justice in accordance with Mosaic law
questions.explanation: The involvement of rulers and judges in Ezra 10:14 reflects the decentralized judicial system outlined in Exodus 18 and Deuteronomy 16, where elders and judges adjudicated communal matters according to God’s law.

questions.question: The delegation of the investigation to Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahaziah son of Tikvah, assisted by Levites (Ezra 10:15), illustrates what about the religious leadership post-exile?
options: A collaborative approach between priestly and Levitical authorities
A sole priestly authority without lay involvement
A Persian-imposed bureaucratic system
A rejection of Levites in judicial matters
questions.correctAnswer: A collaborative approach between priestly and Levitical authorities
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:15 shows a shared responsibility between priests and Levites in addressing covenant violations, indicating a restoration of religious leadership roles in the post-exilic community.

questions.question: The detailed listing of men who had taken strange wives (Ezra 10:18-44) serves what literary and theological purpose in the narrative?
options: To provide transparency and communal accountability
To shame only the priests, ignoring others
To celebrate the diversity of Israel
To obscure the scope of the problem
questions.correctAnswer: To provide transparency and communal accountability
questions.explanation: The extensive names in Ezra 10:18-44 underscore the communal nature of the covenant breach and emphasize public accountability, reinforcing the seriousness of covenant faithfulness.

questions.question: What type of covenant renewal structure is suggested by the sequence of confession, oath, investigation, and separation found in Ezra 10?
options: A covenantal restoration ritual following exile
A new covenant replacing the Mosaic covenant
A purely political treaty with Persia
A sacrificial atonement without covenant elements
questions.correctAnswer: A covenantal restoration ritual following exile
questions.explanation: The process in Ezra 10 reflects a covenant renewal pattern involving confession, oath-taking, judicial inquiry, and purification, restoring Israel’s covenant identity after exile.

questions.question: How might the theme of separation from foreign wives in Ezra 10 relate typologically to New Testament teachings about purity and the church’s identity?
options: It foreshadows calls for holiness and separation from worldly influences in the church
It contradicts New Testament inclusivity
It is irrelevant to New Testament theology
It supports ethnic exclusivism in all contexts
questions.correctAnswer: It foreshadows calls for holiness and separation from worldly influences in the church
questions.explanation: Ezra 10’s emphasis on separation from foreign wives typologically prefigures New Testament exhortations (e.g., 2 Corinthians 6:14-18) for believers to remain pure and distinct from corrupting influences.

questions.question: True or False: The threat of forfeiting property and being separated from the congregation (Ezra 10:8) is an example of communal sanctions common in ancient Near Eastern societies.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:8 shows that those who disobeyed faced property forfeiture and exclusion, typical communal sanctions in ancient Near Eastern legal systems to enforce social and religious conformity.

questions.question: How does the phrase "trembling because of this matter" (Ezra 10:9) function literarily and theologically within the narrative?
options: It expresses fear of divine judgment and emphasizes the gravity of the covenant breach
It indicates physical weakness from the rain only
It is a metaphor for political instability
It suggests joy at reunion
questions.correctAnswer: It expresses fear of divine judgment and emphasizes the gravity of the covenant breach
questions.explanation: The trembling in Ezra 10:9 symbolizes the people's deep awareness of their sin and fearful anticipation of God’s wrath, heightening the narrative tension and call to repentance.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Ezra 10:19, the guilty men who put away their wives offered a _____ of the flock for their trespass.
options: ram
goat
bull
lamb
questions.correctAnswer: ram
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:19 specifies that those guilty offered a ram for their trespass, indicating an atoning sacrifice consistent with Levitical law to seek forgiveness.

theological.title: Ezra Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ezra Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What motivated Ezra to pray and confess before the house of God in Ezra 10?
options: The people's sin of intermarrying with foreign wives
The destruction of the temple
The absence of priests in Israel
A drought in the land
questions.correctAnswer: The people's sin of intermarrying with foreign wives
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:1 shows Ezra praying and confessing because the people had sinned by taking strange wives. This reflects God's holiness and the call for purity in God's covenant people (Deut 7:3-4, Neh 13:23-27, 2 Cor 6:14-16, James 4:8).

questions.question: Who encouraged Ezra to lead Israel in covenant renewal to put away foreign wives?
options: Shechaniah son of Jehiel
Jonathan son of Asahel
Meshullam the Levite
Jeshua son of Jozadak
questions.correctAnswer: Shechaniah son of Jehiel
questions.explanation: In Ezra 10:2-3, Shechaniah son of Jehiel acknowledges the trespass and urges Ezra to lead the covenant renewal. This shows the role of godly leaders in calling the people back to covenant faithfulness (1 Kings 8:33-34, Neh 9:38, Heb 13:17, 1 Tim 3:1-7).

questions.question: What was the nature of the covenant the people agreed to make in Ezra 10?
options: To put away all foreign wives and their children
To rebuild the temple
To fast and pray for rain
To appoint new priests and Levites
questions.correctAnswer: To put away all foreign wives and their children
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:3 describes the covenant to put away foreign wives and their children according to God's law. This underscores the seriousness of covenant purity and obedience (Deut 7:3-4, Ezra 9:11, 2 Cor 6:17, Rev 18:4).

questions.question: How did the people respond when Ezra told them to confess and separate from foreign wives?
options: They answered with a loud voice agreeing to do as Ezra said
They rejected the proposal and rebelled
They asked for more time to consider
They consulted foreign nations for advice
questions.correctAnswer: They answered with a loud voice agreeing to do as Ezra said
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:12 records the congregation agreeing with a loud voice to confess and obey, demonstrating repentance and submission to God's commands (2 Chr 7:14, Ps 34:18, 1 John 1:9, Acts 3:19).

questions.question: What role did Ezra fulfill in this chapter according to the text?
options: Priest, intercessor, and covenant mediator
Military commander
King of Israel
Prophet to the nations
questions.correctAnswer: Priest, intercessor, and covenant mediator
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:1,5,6 show Ezra praying, leading confession, and making the people swear to covenant obedience, reflecting the priestly role of interceding and mediating God's covenant (Exod 28:1, Heb 7:23-28, 1 Tim 2:5, Rom 8:34).

questions.question: How did the people show the seriousness of their sin in response to Ezra's prayer and confession?
options: They wept very sore and assembled in great numbers
They offered burnt offerings immediately
They fasted for seven days
They built an altar outside the city
questions.correctAnswer: They wept very sore and assembled in great numbers
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:1 describes the people's deep sorrow and gathering, showing conviction of sin and desire for restoration (Joel 2:12-13, Ps 51:17, Neh 1:4, James 4:8).

questions.question: What enforcement measure was proclaimed to ensure the people gathered for this covenant renewal?
options: Those who did not come within three days would forfeit their property and be separated
Those who came late would be fined
The city gates would be closed
Foreigners would be expelled from the city
questions.correctAnswer: Those who did not come within three days would forfeit their property and be separated
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:8 shows a strict decree that non-compliance would result in loss of possessions and separation, emphasizing the gravity of covenant obedience (Deut 28:15, Neh 5:1-13, Heb 10:25, Gal 6:1).

questions.question: What was Ezra's physical response when he went into Johanan's chamber after praying?
options: He ate no bread nor drank water because he mourned
He offered a burnt sacrifice
He rested and slept
He anointed himself with oil
questions.correctAnswer: He ate no bread nor drank water because he mourned
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:6 indicates Ezra's fasting as an expression of mourning over Israel's sin, reflecting humility and repentance (Esther 4:16, Dan 9:3-4, Matt 6:16-18, Joel 2:12).

questions.question: How long did the process of examining those who had taken foreign wives last?
options: From the first day of the tenth month to the first day of the first month
One day
Seven days
One year
questions.correctAnswer: From the first day of the tenth month to the first day of the first month
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:16-17 shows the examination began on the first day of the tenth month and ended by the first day of the first month, marking a thorough process of repentance and correction (Neh 13:23-27, Lev 20:21, 2 Chr 34:21-33, Heb 12:11).

questions.question: What did the sons of the priests who had taken strange wives do to demonstrate repentance?
options: They gave their hands to put away their wives and offered a ram for trespass
They fled to another land
They built a new altar
They fasted for forty days
questions.correctAnswer: They gave their hands to put away their wives and offered a ram for trespass
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:18-19 describes priestly families committing to put away foreign wives and offering a ram as a trespass offering, acknowledging guilt and seeking atonement (Lev 5:14-19, Num 15:27-31, Heb 9:22, 1 John 1:7).

questions.question: What does the command to separate from foreign wives illustrate about God's covenant people?
options: The call to holiness and separation from worldly influences
The acceptance of all peoples into Israel
The importance of political alliances
The value of cultural integration
questions.correctAnswer: The call to holiness and separation from worldly influences
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:11 shows the command to separate from foreign wives, emphasizing God's demand for holiness and purity among His people (Lev 20:24-26, 2 Cor 6:14-18, 1 Pet 1:14-16, James 4:4).

questions.question: What was the people's attitude toward the work of putting away foreign wives, as expressed in the chapter?
options: They said it was too much to do in one or two days because many had transgressed
They were eager to finish immediately
They refused to comply
They delegated the task to foreigners
questions.correctAnswer: They said it was too much to do in one or two days because many had transgressed
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:13 reveals the practical difficulty and seriousness of the work, recognizing the widespread sin and need for patient correction (Neh 9:2-3, Ps 38:4-8, Rom 12:12, 2 Tim 2:24-26).

questions.question: Which group helped Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahaziah in the matter of putting away foreign wives?
options: Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite
The chief priests
The elders of every city
The singers and porters
questions.correctAnswer: Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:15 names Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite assisting Jonathan and Jahaziah, showing the role of Levites in upholding covenant purity and order (Num 3:5-10, 1 Chr 15:16, Heb 7:11-28, 1 Tim 3:8-13).

questions.question: What does the chapter imply about God's attribute of holiness?
options: God requires His people to be holy and separate from sin
God tolerates all cultural practices
God does not concern Himself with marriage choices
God only judges kings and priests
questions.correctAnswer: God requires His people to be holy and separate from sin
questions.explanation: Ezra 10:3,11 demonstrates God's demand for holiness, requiring separation from sin to maintain covenant relationship (Lev 11:44-45, 1 Pet 1:15-16, Heb 12:14, Rev 21:27).

questions.question: How does Ezra 10's focus on covenant renewal and repentance connect to the theme of salvation history?
options: It shows God's ongoing work to restore His people in covenant faithfulness
It marks the end of God's covenant with Israel
It introduces a new covenant replacing the old
It emphasizes salvation by works alone
questions.correctAnswer: It shows God's ongoing work to restore His people in covenant faithfulness
questions.explanation: Ezra 10 illustrates God's faithfulness in restoring covenant relationship after judgment, a theme fulfilled ultimately in Christ's mediation (Jer 31:31-34, Heb 8:6-13, Rom 11:26-27, 2 Cor 5:18-21).
